generalInfo.description: Earth is the fifth largest planet in the solar system and the only one with liquid water on its surface. It is slightly larger than Venus and is the largest of the terrestrial planets.
generalInfo.namesake: The name Earth is derived from Old English and Germanic, meaning 'the ground.' Unlike other planets, Earth is not named after Greek or Roman mythology.
generalInfo.age: The name 'Earth' is at least 1,000 years old.

potentialForLife.description: Earth's hospitable temperature and chemical mix have made it abundant in life. It is unique for having most of its surface covered in liquid water, which allowed life to begin 3.8 billion years ago.
potentialForLife.climateChangeImpact: Features that make Earth suitable for life are changing due to climate change.

sizeAndDistance.rank: Fifth largest planet in the solar system

orbitAndRotation.leapYearExplanation: Every four years, an extra day is added as a leap day.
orbitAndRotation.seasonalEffects: The tilt causes seasonal variations due to differential solar heating.

moons.description: Earth's Moon stabilizes its axial tilt, affecting the climate.
moons.origin: The Moon likely formed from debris after a collision billions of years ago.
moons.rankInSize: Fifth largest moon in the solar system

formation.description: Earth formed about 4.5 billion years ago from swirling gas and dust pulled together by gravity.

layers.name: Inner Core
layers.description: A solid sphere of iron and nickel, 1,221 kilometers in radius, with temperatures up to 5,400 degrees Celsius.

layers.name: Outer Core
layers.description: A 2,300-kilometer-thick layer of molten iron and nickel.

layers.name: Mantle
layers.description: A viscous layer of molten rock, 2,900 kilometers thick.

layers.name: Crust
layers.description: A solid outer layer, averaging 30 kilometers in depth on land and 5 kilometers under oceans.

surface.features: Earth has mountains, valleys, canyons, and plains. Its lithosphere is divided into tectonic plates that move constantly.
surface.oceanCoverage: 70% of Earth's surface is covered by oceans, which hold 97% of its water.
surface.volcanicActivity: Most volcanoes are underwater, including Mauna Kea, taller than Everest from base to summit.

atmosphere.protection: The atmosphere shields Earth from harmful solar radiation and meteoroids.

magnetosphere.cause: Earth's rapid rotation and molten nickel-iron core.
magnetosphere.effects: The magnetic field deflects solar wind and causes aurorae at the poles.
magnetosphere.polarityReversal: Magnetic polarity flips approximately every 400,000 years without harming life.
